question_sentence: The Indian government controversially decided to limit the export of what foodstuff?
evidence: India, which supplies about 40% of the world’s rice exports, took the unprecedented step of banning the export of non-basmati white rice, in an effort to curb domestic inflation. But the move is likely to push up prices all over the world.

question_sentence: Which South African politician has been locked in a war of words with billionaire businessman Elon Musk?
choices: Julius Malema, of the Economic Freedom Fighters
Cyril Ramaphosa, of the African National Congress
Velenkosini Hlabisa, of the Inkatha Freedom Party
evidence: Elon Musk accused Julius Malema, the leader of South Africa’s second largest opposition party, of “pushing for the genocide of white people” after he was filmed chanting “Kill the Boer”, a reference to the country’s historic white settlers. Malema had previously told reporters that Musk seemed “illiterate”.

question_sentence: Scientists from which country claimed to have discovered the world’s first room-temperature superconductor?
evidence: A research team from Seoul, South Korea, caused a global stir by claiming to have discovered a compound that can operate as a superconductor at room temperature, a finding that would have almost incalculable value. But the scientific community at large remains deeply sceptical and has thus far failed to reproduce the results.

question_sentence: What is the name of the latest Covid variant surging in the UK?
evidence: A descendant of the Omicron variant, EG.5.1 – nicknamed Eris by T. Ryan Gregory, a Canadian professor of biology – now accounts for one in seven new Covid cases in the UK. It is the second most prevalent variant after Arcturus, according to the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA).

question_sentence: Which unlikely trade is reportedly losing jobs to AI bots?
evidence: The jobs of clairvoyants, fortune tellers and traditional mystics are being taken over by AI bots, in “a bleak future they did not see coming”, said the Daily Star. Artificial intelligence mediums apparently use algorithms to divine the customer’s future. For more strange and unlikely stories, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: What was the final score in the penalty shoot-out for the FA Community Shield last weekend?
evidence: Arsenal beat Manchester City 4-1 on penalties in the Community Shield at Wembley last weekend after the match finished 1-1 after extra-time. Man City’s Kevin De Bruyne and Rodri both missed their penalties, which led to Arsenal’s Fábio Vieira scoring the clincher for last season’s Premier League runners-up.

question_sentence: Which high-profile actor unexpectedly showed up at an art show dedicated to him?
evidence: Pedro Pascal, best known for his roles in “Narcos” and “The Last of Us”, turned up to a fan’s art show based on him last weekend – only to find it closed. The art show, named “ADHD Hyper Fixation and why it looks like I love Pedro Pascal”, was created by 45-year-old artist Heidi Gentle Burrell, and is showing at the Rhodes Gallery in Margate, Kent.

question_sentence: What viral term describes scheduling multiple dates in one day?
evidence: A Sunday Times journalist recently faced a backlash for trying out a viral dating trend known as “date stacking”, or scheduling multiple dates in a day. Find out more about the trend in The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A Texan gardener was attacked by two animals simultaneously while mowing her lawn. What were they?
evidence: Peggy Jones was attacked by a snake and a hawk while out mowing her lawn. The 64-year-old said the snake appeared to fall out of the sky and wrapped itself around her arm before the hawk, which had seemingly been carrying the snake, swooped down and repeatedly clawed at her, trying to reclaim its prey.

question_sentence: Who, according to a new poll, is the United States’ most popular public figure?
evidence: The Prince of Wales is a hit across the pond, topping a Gallup survey that asked Americans for their views on 15 prominent public figures. Prince William was the strongest candidate, with 59% of the vote, ahead of the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, at 57%. Donald Trump was in sixth place with 41%.

question_sentence: Which tropical island faced deadly wildfires this week?
evidence: Dozens of people have died in Maui wildfires that overwhelmed hospitals, demolished homes and destroyed cultural sites.

question_sentence: Which team was dramatically knocked out of the Women’s World Cup during a penalty shootout against Sweden?
evidence: The US Women’s National Team was shockingly eliminated from the Women’s World Cup in the round-of-16 after losing a penalty shootout against Sweden. It was the earliest exit ever for the two-time reigning champions at the tournament.

question_sentence: Under a new law passed this week, which state is now allowing drivers to pump their own gas?
evidence: Oregon drivers are now allowed to pump their own gas after the state lifted a 1951 ban aimed at preserving the jobs of service station attendants. This leaves New Jersey as the only state in the US where customers can’t pump their own fuel.

question_sentence: Oddly enough, preparations are underway for a cage fight between Elon Musk and which other billionaire?
evidence: The cage match between billionaires Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg does not yet have a scheduled date, but according to Musk, it will be streamed on X, formerly known as Twitter.

question_sentence: Which bank encountered a technical issue that made some customers’ direct deposits disappear from their accounts?
evidence: Wells Fargo said it has resolved a glitch that made some customers unable to see recent check deposit transactions.

question_sentence: Video footage of a large brawl on a boat dock captivated the internet this week. Where did the fight occur?
evidence: At least three people have been charged in connection with a brawl at a riverfront dock in Montgomery, Alabama. The fight between the men, identified by authorities as White, and a Black co-captain of a riverboat, has turned a spotlight on the city’s racial history.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden designated a new national monument this week surrounding which popular tourist destination?
evidence: President Joe Biden on Tuesday designated the fifth national monument of his presidency and unveiled new climate resilience funding for national parks during a visit to lands surrounding one of the seven natural wonders of the world, the Grand Canyon.

question_sentence: Which tech company is moving forward with its plan to delete accounts that have been inactive for at least two years?
evidence: Google plans to start deleting inactive accounts in December to prevent security risks. The company said it will send multiple warning notifications to impacted accounts and their backup emails before deletions begin.

question_sentence: Which type of bright celestial display will be visible in parts of the Northern Hemisphere this weekend?
evidence: The annual Perseid meteor shower, one of nature’s most stunning light displays, will peak on August 12 and 13.

question_sentence: A lottery ticket sold in which state won Tuesday’s $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot?
evidence: One ticket sold in Florida won the estimated $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot this week – expected to be the largest in the lottery’s history.

question_sentence: What is the primary time frame for the "bed bug season"?
What was Krispy Kreme offering to customers with losing lottery tickets?
choices: A discount on their next purchase

question_sentence: What inspired the name and design of the vintage coin-operated kiddie ride "Champion" at Funland in Rehoboth Beach?
Which sources have been used to track Delaware gas prices and help people find the lowest prices?
choices: Weather forecasts and local news stations

question_sentence: What type of diet did Bradie Crandall adopt, which goes against the traditional notion of a protein-rich diet for muscle-building exercises?
What is the current estimated population of adult Atlantic sturgeon breeding in the Delaware River?
What is the primary issue raised by the families who have filed lawsuits against Arden Courts?
choices: Lack of proper medical equipment in the facility.

question_sentence: What type of weather event caused the damage to parts of northwest Delaware this week?
What does the data from the Delaware Department of Education show about student proficiency in the years following the COVID-19 crisis?
choices: Student proficiency has significantly increased across all subjects compared to pre-pandemic levels.
Student proficiency has slightly decreased across all subjects compared to pre-pandemic levels.
Student proficiency has varied across subjects, with some improvements and some declines compared to pre-pandemic levels.

question_sentence: What prompted the closure of Fordham and Dominion Brewing, one of the oldest and largest breweries in Delaware?
choices: Declining beer sales and lack of customer interest
The out-of-state owners' decision to shut down the brewery
